Title: Suspiciously Green Smoothie
Description: A smoothie that glows faintly.  We're not responsible for any superpowers (or side effects) you may develop.
Ingredients: 1 cup Spinach (that looks a *little* too vibrant)
3 Ice cubes (made from questionable tap water)

Steps.Content: Combine all ingredients in a blender.  Don't look directly at it.
Blend until smooth, or until it starts to hum ominously.
Pour into a glass.  If it fizzes, proceed with extreme caution.  Drink at your own risk.

Title: Existential Dread Casserole
Description: A casserole that stares back.  May induce feelings of profound emptiness.  Enjoy?
Ingredients: 1 can Cream of Mushroom Soup (the void in a can)
1 cup Tater Tots (shaped like tiny screaming faces)
1/2 cup Cheese (that seems to watch you)

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 350°F.  Contemplate the meaninglessness of it all.
Brown the ground beef in a skillet.  Drain any excess despair.
Mix beef, soup, and regret in a casserole dish.  Top with tater tots and cheese.  Bake until bubbly and your spirit is crushed.

Title: Roadkill Surprise Stir-fry
Description: We... uh... found these ingredients.  Somewhere.  It's a stir-fry!  That's all you need to know.
CookTime: 15 minutes (or until you can't identify the ingredients anymore)
Ingredients: 1 cup Assorted Vegetables (found on the side of the road)
1 tsp Garlic Powder (to mask any... unusual... flavors)

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a wok or large skillet.  Try not to think about where the ingredients came from.
Add 'Mystery Meat' and stir-fry until... cooked?  Add vegetables and continue to stir-fry.
Stir in soy sauce and garlic powder.  Serve immediately.  Don't ask questions.

Title: Grandma's 'Special' Fruitcake
Description: Grandma's been acting strange lately, and this fruitcake is proof.  It's heavy, dense, and might contain... well, anything.
CookTime: Unknown (it's been in the attic for decades)
Ingredients: Dried Fruit (of indeterminate age and species)
Booze (enough to fuel a small rocket)

Steps.Content: Locate the fruitcake (it's usually hidden for a reason).
Attempt to cut a slice (you'll need a chainsaw).
Dispose of properly (call hazardous waste disposal).

Title: Radioactive Ramen
Description: This ramen glows in the dark.  We're not sure why.  Eat at your own peril.
CookTime: 3 minutes (plus time for potential cellular restructuring)
Ingredients: 1 package Ramen Noodles (with suspiciously bright seasoning)
1 Egg (that may or may not hatch into something unusual)
Optional: Anything you find in a fallout shelter

Steps.Content: Boil water in a pot.  If it starts to glow, that's... normal?
Add noodles and cook for 3 minutes.  Crack the egg into the pot (if you dare).
Stir in seasoning packet.  Serve in a lead-lined bowl.

Title: Burnt Offering Burgers
Description: We tried to make burgers.  We failed.  These are charred beyond recognition.  Maybe the gods will accept them?

Steps.Content: Start with good intentions.  Quickly abandon them.
Grill (or incinerate) the burgers until they resemble hockey pucks.
Assemble the 'burgers'.  Apologize to your stomach.

Title: Alien Autopsy Aspic
Description: A gelatinous monstrosity inspired by questionable government documents. Contains unidentifiable 'meat' products.

Steps.Content: Dissolve gelatin in 'broth'.  Don't inhale the fumes.
Chop canned meats into vaguely organ-shaped pieces.
Combine gelatin mixture, meats, and food coloring in a mold.  Chill until set.  Question your sanity.

Title: Hair of the Dog Chili
Description: We're not sure *what* kind of hair is in this chili, but it's definitely... hairy. And probably best avoided.
Ingredients: Chili Seasoning (extra spicy, to distract from the texture)

Steps.Content: Brown the ground meat.  Try to ignore the... additions.
Add beans, tomatoes, and chili seasoning.  Simmer.  Pretend it's normal.
Serve hot.  Warn people beforehand.  Or don't.

Title: Soylent Green Bean Casserole
Description: It's green. It's a casserole. The ingredients are... a secret. A *very* well-kept secret.
Ingredients: Fried Onions (for a touch of normalcy)

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 350°F.  Don't ask too many questions.
Mix green beans and soup in a casserole dish.  Top with fried onions.
Bake until bubbly.  Serve to your... 'friends'.

Title: Toe Jam Toast
Description: Someone misread the recipe.  It's not 'Toe Jam', it's... well, it's still pretty bad. Bread with a mysterious, sticky topping.
Ingredients: A jar of 'Jam' (found in the back of the fridge, unlabeled)

Steps.Content: Toast the bread (if you can call it that).
Spread the 'jam' on the toast.  Try not to gag.
Throw it away.  Immediately.

Title: Mystery Meatloaf Surprise
Description: The 'surprise' is that we don't know what kind of meat this is. Or *if* it's meat. Good luck!

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 350°F.  Prepare a will.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl.  Try not to make eye contact with the 'meat'.
Shape into a loaf.  Bake until... done?  Serve with a side of antacids.

Title: Cthulhu's Calamari Calamity
Description: Squid. So much squid. Prepared in ways that defy human comprehension. May induce madness.
Ingredients: An infinite amount of Squid (tentacles and all)
Sea Water (from the deepest, darkest trenches)

Steps.Content: Summon the squid from the abyss.
Prepare according to ancient, forbidden rituals.
Serve to Cthulhu.  Hope he's pleased.

Title: Lutefisk Leftovers Surprise
Description: It's lutefisk. Again. Somehow, it's *worse* than the first time.  Good luck getting rid of it.
Ingredients: Anything you can find to try to mask the flavor (it won't work)

Steps.Content: Open the container.  Try not to faint.
Heat it up (if you dare).  The smell will permeate everything.
Attempt to eat it.  Fail miserably.

Title: Spam Sushi Scandal
Description: Someone thought this was a good idea. They were wrong. Very, very wrong.
Ingredients: 1 can Spam (the culinary embodiment of despair)
Nori Seaweed (used to contain the horror)

Steps.Content: Slice the Spam.  Contemplate your life choices.
Assemble the 'sushi' like you would normal sushi.  Except it's not normal.  It's Spam.
Serve with wasabi.  Lots of wasabi.

Title: Moldy Mac and Cheese
Description: We forgot about this in the back of the fridge.  It's... colorful now.  Eat at your own risk (seriously, don't).
Ingredients: Various types of Mold (a science experiment gone wrong)

Steps.Content: Open the container.  Immediately close it.
Call a hazmat team.
Move to a new house, new city. Start a new life. Never think of this recipe again.

Title: Pickled Pig's Feet Pizza
Description: Why? Just... why? A culinary abomination that combines two things that should never, ever meet.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven.  Pray for forgiveness.
Spread sauce and cheese on the dough.  Arrange pig's feet on top.
Bake until the cheese is melted and your soul is weeping.  Serve to your enemies.

Title: Fugu Fish Taco Fiasco
Description: Fugu, the deadly pufferfish. Prepared by... someone. In a taco. This is a gamble with your life.
Ingredients: Taco Shells (brittle, like your chances of survival)

Steps.Content: Obtain fugu from a questionable source.
Assemble the tacos.  Say your last prayers.
Eat.  Wait for the inevitable.

Title: Durian and Anchovy Ice Cream
Description: The king of fruits meets the smelliest fish. In ice cream form. This is a crime against taste buds.
Serves: People you want to banish from your life
Ingredients: Heavy Cream (trying its best to hold it all together)

Steps.Content: Combine all ingredients in an ice cream maker.  Hold your breath.
Churn until frozen.  The smell will be unbearable.
Serve to your enemies.  From a safe distance.

Title: Century Egg Omelette of Oblivion
Description: Century eggs, preserved in who-knows-what for who-knows-how-long. In an omelette. This is a culinary black hole.
Ingredients: Eggs (fresh, to contrast the ancient ones)
Soy Sauce (to add to the existential dread)
A black hole where your appetite used to be

Steps.Content: Chop the century eggs.  Try not to inhale.
Whisk fresh eggs with soy sauce.  Add century eggs.
Cook the omelette.  Contemplate the end of all things.

Title: Ketchup and Mustard Ice Lolly
Description: Two classic condiments, frozen into a popsicle. The sweet and tangy, savory crime against frozen desserts.
Ingredients: Popsicle Molds (soon to be instruments of torture)

Steps.Content: Fill popsicle molds with ketchup and mustard, experiment with layers or just mixing it all. Ponder on whether you have gone to far this time.
Insert popsicle sticks. Freeze for at least 4 hours, maybe leave it there and forget about it.
Unmold the popsicles. Present this culinary transgression to someone, anyone... or just let it melt in the sink, a silent testament to your questionable decisions.

Title: Tuna Eyeball Tostada
Description: A crunchy tostada topped with... tuna eyeballs.  A delicacy in some (very strange) cultures.  A nightmare in most.

Steps.Content: Carefully place tuna eyeballs on tostada shells.
Top with lettuce, lime, and salsa.  Try not to look directly at it.
Serve to the brave (or foolish).

Title: Fried Chicken Feet with Chocolate Sauce
Description: Chicken feet, deep-fried. Dipped in chocolate. A bizarre combination of textures and flavors that will haunt your dreams.
Serves: People who have lost a bet
Ingredients: Chocolate Sauce (a desperate attempt to salvage this)
Sprinkles (for a touch of false festivity)

Steps.Content: Deep-fry the chicken feet until crispy.  Try not to think about what you're doing.
Dip in chocolate sauce.  Add sprinkles.  Question your sanity.
Serve to the unsuspecting.  Watch their reactions with a mixture of amusement and horror.

Title: Balut in a Blanket
Description: Balut, a developing duck embryo, wrapped in a pastry. A terrifying twist on a classic snack.
Ingredients: Balut (a fertilized duck egg with a partially developed embryo)
Puff Pastry (used to hide the contents)
Egg Wash (for a deceptive golden sheen)

Steps.Content: Wrap the balut in puff pastry.  Try not to look too closely.
Brush with egg wash.  Bake until golden brown.
Serve hot.  Warn people about the contents.  Or don't.

Title: Stinky Tofu Spring Rolls with Strawberry Jam
Description: The pungent aroma of stinky tofu combined with the sweetness of strawberry jam, wrapped in a delicate spring roll. A clash of civilizations on a plate.
Serves: People with adventurous (or damaged) olfactory senses
Ingredients: Stinky Tofu (fermented tofu with a powerful odor)
Vegetables (to add some semblance of normalcy)

Steps.Content: Fill spring roll wrappers with stinky tofu, vegetables, and a dollop of strawberry jam.
Roll tightly.  Try not to breathe too deeply.
Serve with a warning label.

Title: Haggis and Honeycomb Hotpot
Description: Scotland's national dish meets crunchy honeycomb in a hotpot. A textural and flavorful nightmare.
Ingredients: Haggis (sheep's organs cooked in a sheep's stomach)
Broth (trying its best to hold it all together)

Steps.Content: Prepare the hotpot broth.  Add haggis and vegetables.
Add honeycomb.  Watch it melt and mingle with the haggis.
Serve to the bewildered.

Title: Liver and Lima Bean Lollipops
Description: Two of the most hated foods, combined into a lollipop. A truly diabolical creation.

Steps.Content: Combine pureed liver and mashed lima beans.
Form into lollipop shapes and insert sticks.
Freeze until solid.  Distribute to the unfortunate.

Title: Surströmming Salad Sandwich
Description: Surströmming, fermented Baltic Sea herring, known for its overpowering smell. In a sandwich.  A biohazard on bread.
CookTime: 5 minutes (to assemble), an eternity (to get rid of the smell)
Ingredients: Bread (preferably stale, to match the fish)
Mayonnaise (a futile attempt to mask the odor)
Onions (because why not make it worse?)

Steps.Content: Open the can of surströmming *outdoors*, wearing protective gear.  Warn your neighbors.
Spread mayonnaise on the bread.  Layer on the surströmming and onions.
Close the sandwich.  Dispose of properly (incineration recommended).

Title: Peanut Butter and Pickle Pizza
Description: A culinary crime against pizza.  The creamy, nutty peanut butter clashes horribly with the sour, crunchy pickles.
Ingredients: Peanut Butter (smooth or crunchy, it doesn't matter, it's all wrong)

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 400°F.  Question your life choices.
Spread peanut butter on the pizza dough.  Arrange pickles on top.
Add cheese (if desired).  Bake until the crust is golden brown and your kitchen smells like despair.

Title: Broccoli and Candy Corn Casserole
Description: Healthy broccoli meets sugary candy corn in a casserole that defies all logic and good taste.
Ingredients: Broccoli Florets (fresh or frozen, it's all doomed)
Cream of Mushroom Soup (the glue that holds this nightmare together)
A strong desire to punish your taste buds

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 350°F.  Prepare for the worst.
Mix broccoli, candy corn, and soup in a casserole dish.  Top with cheese.
Bake until bubbly and the candy corn has melted into a sticky, sugary mess.

Title: Spaghetti-Os Jell-O Mold
Description: Canned pasta rings suspended in a wobbly, jiggly Jell-O mold. A retro nightmare.
Ingredients: 1 package Jell-O (any flavor, it doesn't matter)
A time machine to go back and prevent this from happening

Steps.Content: Prepare Jell-O according to package directions.
Stir in Spaghetti-Os.  Pour into a mold.
Chill until set.  Serve to the bewildered and horrified.
